explaination: walking tour talking about the history of cartegena

coffee farm where they explained how they grow coffee and harvet it
went up to see the glaciers in colombia, which felt like walking on the moon. relaxed at some host springs

spent too much money to see jesus in an underground church. was a wild ride of religion and tourism
took a salsa class with the amazing Christien who is so much fun to dance with

walking tour showing the history of quito

explaination of how they gorw and make chocolate. great choclate tasting
climbing down a set of waterfalls, and jumping off the last one
white water rafting down the pastaza river
white water rafting down the pastaza river
the longest walking tour ever learning about the religious history of cuenca
pretty bad surf lesson where we got pushed on white wash waves. waste of money
stunning hike seeing glaciers and going up to an amazing blue lake
horse riding up to a none existent view point on the worst horses ever
multi day trek around the stunning cordillera huayhuash. second most beautiful trek in the world
sand skiing down the dunes of huacachina and dune buggy ripping
historical talk about the Nazca lines and Maria Reiche who dedicated her life to protecting them
going to see the mountains that have multiple minerals giving it rainbow colouring
historical walking tour of the downtown of arequipa
there are a bunch of floating island made out of reeds that people live on.
women and men in traditional garb fighting it out in the most hilarious wrestling matches
mountain biking from high up along the death road into the rain forest. didnt die. could see how people did
amazing. crazy dave!
trip into the floodlands of the amazon where we spent most of our time on a boat viewing wildlife (caimen and alligators)
trip into the actual amazon rainforest with machetes and a wee bit of food to fish and build our own shelters. were lead by crazy indigenous Jesus. great dude
mountaineering trip to 6088m summit for sunrise. learned how to ice climb
hike through a beautiful canyon and too see some 72 million year old dinosaur footprints
trip to visit a cool rock formation and did some splunking in small cool caves
historical walk through the city learning about indigenous, inca and spanish history
multi day tour to see the salt flats and the atacami desert, as well as some nice lakes
we went into the active mines to learn about what it was like, and to blow up some dynamite
flotation through a beautiful super clear river. lots of fish and very relaxing. came very close to an alligator
tour of a famous lake in a cave. very blue. very expensive
floating down a river on tubes as well as climbing through trees. super safe. im better at it than 5 yr olds
tour in a 4x4 into the national park to see some lakes and dunes. very tourist. little heart
tour ito watch the stars and sleep in the dunes over night. woke up for a beautiful sunrise
tour to a more distant beautiful lake. stunning. stopped at another beautiful lake for an amazing sunset
buggy tour to sights and beaches north of natal. sim emocao
surf trip to a different beach with a cute town. we had a lesson while there. i broke some guys board whoops.
buggy tour to see the main tourist sites and take pictures
went to see the natural pools and do some snorkeling (or picture taking) and to see the jesus walk, that was covered in water
trek into the valley to stay for 3 days to go see main viewpoints and waterfalls. stunning
took a van day tour to visit popular sights around the chapada
took a lesson with a local guy wh brought us out to a nice beach to learn, surf and hangout at
hanging out on a boat, snorkeling and visting beaches on little islands
diving at a spectacular sight to see hammerhead sharks and rays
a drive and walk to the biggest volcano crater on the island and to see the lava fields
tour of a collapsed lava field with boobies, turtles, snorkeling and sea horses

tour: gordon rocks and punta carrion dive
explaination: relaxed dive in punta carrion to then a dive gordon rocks getting up close to hammerheads
dive along the famous kicker rock to see hammerheads and bate balls
guided tour through the Mayan ruins before spending some time on my own wandering through other parts of the ruins
candle lit tour through flooded cave system
mayan led ceremony on cacao and fire, including information on mayan calendar and spirits, as well as prayer
sunrise hike to look over lake atitlan and the volcanoes. quite cloudy
very excited walking tour by happy harold listening to the history of antigua
beautiful hike up one volcano to see fuego, as well as a sunrise hike. sadly no explosions

hiking up a volcano, boarding down, party bus. craziness
amazing walking tour with alejandro who did a great job walking us through the history of both nicaragua and leon. this might have been one of the best and most informative walking tours I've been on

a look into el salvador history, the civil war, the gang conflicts and the response afterwords from the perspective of a 19yr old
with the right luck i managed to end up on the sardine run last minute. 5 days of 6-7 hours on the water searching for dolphins, birds, bait balls, sharks and whales. what an amazing experience
rough waves, sea sickness and a dropped bait ball made for an interesting excursion. did get to do a cool drift dive and see some raggies though
the guide literally rammed us into a nest of hippos while i sat on the front of the boat. sick
chill shallow dives on pretty reef looking at some small stuff. colourful fish
single relaxed dive checking out some coral and fun fishies
really fun heavy current dives. got up close and personal with some ragged tooth sharks. had an adventure on the descent and had to drag through current. still super fun
amazing game drive. got to see a buffalo kill with some lion cubs eating it. saw hyena, saw male lions. gorgeous sunset
got to see lions, a leopard, genets and lots more. petross the guide is tedious
interesting walk in the kruger. heard some lions, saw some elephants, got lectured about pharmaceuticals and how everything is caused by sugar. better at identifying poop and footprints now
malawians really like to walk straight up mountains. no switch backs. amazing cabins, people and hiking with henry
nice dives, some rays and a sleeping leopard shark
its like they tried to stay as far away from whales as possible
currenty dives on some reefs, saw lots of rays including small eyed stingrays and marbled electric rays
incredible luck. swam with whal sharks threee times. saw a pod of dolphins. just missed seeing whales in the water, but saw a lot from the surface
beautiful water, dunes and island. super expensive. ate my body weight in prawns, calamari and fish to make up for it. get those beans away from me
best last minute deal we could have made to. very authenic and very wet. slow leak in boat included
it was just the 2 sharks actually. and a lot of sea sickness. not worth it
amazing dancing, singing and culture. some questionable jokes though. yea
getting drunk on the back of donkeys. we stole them for a short while too
